{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, subdural empyema can be a complication of sinusitis. Sinusitis is an infection or inflammation of the sinuses, which are air-filled spaces in the skull. If the infection spreads from the sinuses to the surrounding tissues, it can lead to the formation of a subdural empyema, which is a collection of pus between the dura mater (the outermost layer of the brain) and the arachnoid mater (the middle layer of the brain). This can occur due to the direct spread of infection from the sinuses to the brain or through the bloodstream. Therefore, the answer is A. yes.", "answer_choice": "A"}
